programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Aliens And Mysterious Mountains: Throughout time, people have believed mountains were the home of the divine. But could these hilltop spirits have been extraterrestrials? (S6, ep 3)

programme.title: The Thundermans

programme.title: The Thundermans

programme.title: ALVINNN!!! and the Chipmunks

programme.title: ALVINNN!!! and the Chipmunks

programme.title: ALVINNN!!! and the Chipmunks
programme.desc: Snake Charmer: Alvin and Simon create a fake snake to help Dave get over his fear of the real ones.

programme.title: The Loud House
programme.desc: The Louds think Lori is failing out of Fairway U in 'Crashed Course', and then in 'Puns and Buns', Benny struggles to rein in Luan and her practical jokes when she becomes his coworker. (S6, ep 13)

programme.title: The Patrick Star Show
programme.desc: The enemies of the Star family team up to exact their revenge in 'Best Served Cold', then in 'Tattoo Hullabaloo', Bunny's sailor tattoo finds himself in trouble. (S2, ep 9)

programme.title: The Thundermans
programme.desc: He Got Game Night: Hank raises the stakes of family game night to a new high, and each member of the family will do whatever it takes to win the grand prize. (S3, ep 15)

programme.title: Henry Danger
programme.desc: A Finata Full Of Death Bugs: When a dangerous pinata ends up at a kids' birthday party, Kid Danger and Captain Man must go undercover and step in before it's too late. (S3, ep 1)

programme.title: Monster High
programme.desc: Cleo gets conflicting predictions from a new app in 'Hororscare', and then in 'Flaunt Your Skeleton', Ghoulia's dream and nightmare is about to come true! (S1, ep 11)

programme.title: Monster High
programme.desc: Draculaura, Clawdeen & Frankie meet Twyla, a boogey monster, in 'Creepover Party', and in 'Creature Clash', Frankie tries a ritual without Kuma's help and turns dead students into zombies. (S1, ep 12)

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: SpongeBob watches Mr. Krabs's house while he's away in 'Knock Knock, Who's There?', then in 'Pat Hearts Squid', Squidward is forced to room with Patrick, and Patrick begins to take after him.

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: A statue of Mr. Krabs is erected by Squidward in 'The Masterpiece', and then in 'Whelk Attack', Bikini Bottom gets invaded by large sea whelks.

programme.title: The Secret of Seagull Island
programme.desc: 1982. Drama. Directed by Nestore Ungaro. Stars Jeremy Brett, Prunella Ransome & Nicky Henson. In Rome, a woman embarks on a chilling journey to find her blind sister who mysteriously disappeared.

programme.title: Patterns
programme.desc: 1956. Drama. Directed by Fielder Cook. Stars Van Heflin, Everett Sloane & Ed Begley. Fred Staples finds his ambitions and ethics at odds after being employed by a renowned New York corporation. [S]

programme.title: The Voice Within
programme.desc: 1946. Crime. Directors Isadore Goldsmith & Maurice J. Wilson. Stars Kieron Moore & Barbara White. A young man joins a gang of smugglers but runs into trouble after accidently killing a policeman. [S]

programme.title: Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: The Case of Harry Crocker. 1954. Starring: Ronald Howard, Howard Marion-Crawford & Archie Duncan. Escape artist Harry Crocker turns to Sherlock Holmes when he is accused of strangling a girl. [S]

programme.title: Once In a New Moon
programme.desc: 1935. Sci-Fi. Stars Eliot Makeham, Rene Ray & Derrick de Marney. A small town gets dragged out into space and the populace try to organise a local government based on equal rights for all. [S]

programme.title: Look At Life The City's for Living In
programme.desc: 1968. A response to the Buchanan Report, with a focus on Bath and Norwich, as to how British towns and cities are dealing with the impact of traffic on the environment.

programme.title: Come Back Peter
programme.desc: 1952. Comedy. Director: Charles Saunders. Stars Patrick Holt, Peter Hammond, Humphrey Lestocq & Kathleen Boutall. Pandemonium is created in a home when various relatives come to stay. [S]

programme.title: Subway in the Sky
programme.desc: 1959. Drama. Directed by Muriel Box. Starring Hildegard Knef, Katherine Kath & Van Johnson. A military doctor is falsely accused of dealing illegal drugs. Can he prove his innocence? [S]

programme.title: Gallant Journey
programme.desc: 1946. Drama. Directed by William A. Wellman. Stars Glenn Ford, Janet Blair & Charlie Ruggles. Biopic of US aviation pioneer John J. Montgomery who battled the odds to build a successful glider. [S]

programme.title: Suspected Person
programme.desc: 1942. Drama. Director: Lawrence Huntington. Stars Clifford Evans, Patricia Roc, David Farrar, Robert Beatty, William Hartnell. Two bank robbers try to find their partner, who fled to London. [S]

programme.title: The Pretty Things On Film
programme.desc: 1966. An incredible promotional short for the English rock band The Pretty Things.

programme.title: Crown Court
programme.desc: No Smoke Without Fire - Part 1. 1973. Stars Barry Jackson & Derek Waring. Mr Bennington is charged with causing arson at the home of his estranged wife's boss, publisher Jeremy Clements. [S]

programme.title: Crown Court
programme.desc: No Smoke Without Fire - Part 2. 1973. Stars Maria Aitken, Mollie Maureen. Edward's former wife gives evidence, and Nellie Kent tells of a telephone call she overheard on the night of the fire. [S]

programme.title: Crown Court
programme.desc: No Smoke Without Fire - Part 3. 1973. Stars John Bailey & Sarah Lawson. Edward's brother Donald attempts to explain his erratic behaviour and Mrs. Clements takes to the stand to give evidence. [S]

programme.title: Notorious (1946)
programme.desc: 1946. Drama. Directed by Alfred Hitchcock. Stars Cary Grant, Ingrid Bergman & Claude Rains. A woman is asked to spy on a group of Nazi friends in South America, but how far will she have to go? [S]

programme.title: Holiday All The Way
programme.desc: A charming travelogue of coach tours available throughout the UK and on the continent in the 50s/60s.

programme.title: Those British Faces
programme.desc: 1993. Documentary series that acts as a tribute to the greats of British cinema. This episode looks at the great Alastair Sim, narrated by Richard Todd. [S]

programme.title: The Cheaters
programme.desc: The Man Who Wouldn't Be Paid. 1961. Stars John Ireland & Ian Fleming. Benjamin Clarke buys a rare book for a fraction of its real worth and puts himself at the mercy of his gold-digging family. [S]

programme.title: The Brothers
programme.desc: The Mole. 1976. Stars Richard Easton, Robin Chadwick & Clive Swift. Griffith Trevelyan, Chief Sales Executive of RAI Transport, decides to play games with the rival companies bidding for his firm. [S]

programme.title: Travelling Man
programme.desc: Sudden Death. 1984. Stars Leigh Lawson, Colin Jeavons, Tony Doyle. Lomax returns to London for his mother's funeral. Afterwards, he targets Pember - a man who might be able to help clear his name. [S]

programme.title: The Gold Robbers
programme.desc: The Cover Plan. 1969. Stars Peter Vaughan, Frederick Bartman & Patrick Allen. A mercenary tries to smuggle a woman out of the country, but Cradock is interested in his connection to the robbery. [S]

programme.title: The Nudist Story
programme.desc: 1960. Drama. Director: Ramsey Herrington. Stars Shelley Martin, Brian Cobby, Natalie Lynn. A woman is horrified when she inherits a nudist camp but her views are challenged when she falls in love. [S]

programme.title: The Nudist Story
programme.desc: 1960. Drama. Director: Ramsey Herrington. Stars Shelley Martin, Brian Cobby, Natalie Lynn. A woman is horrified when she inherits a nudist camp but her views are challenged when she falls in love. [S]

programme.title: The Rough and the Smooth
programme.desc: 1959. Drama. Starring Nadja Tiller, Tony Britton and William Bendix. Directed by Robert Siodmak. An archaeologist forsakes his fiancée for a passionate affair with a beautiful German woman. [S]

programme.title: Shadows on the Stairs
programme.desc: 1941. Crime. Director: D. Ross Lederman. Stars Frieda Inescort & Paul Cavanagh. Occupants of a boarding house become suspects after a string of murders. [S]

programme.title: A Yank In Ermine
programme.desc: 1955. Comedy. An American air-man (Peter Thompson) inherits an English title but will he cope with English nobility? Starring Jon Pertwee and Sid James. [S]

programme.title: Lily of Killarney
programme.desc: 1934. Set in Ireland, a poor Landowner's rival frames him for a murder. Stars John Garrick & Stanley Holloway is well suited to his semi-comic role as a baritone Father O'Flynn. [S]

programme.title: Stars In Your Eyes
programme.desc: 1956. Musical. Directed by Maurice Elvey. Stars Nat Jackley, Pat Kirkwood & Bonar Colleano. A group of talented entertainers band together to purchase a run-down theatre to put on a show. [S]

programme.title: Stranger In Town
programme.desc: 1957. Drama. Directed George Pollock. Starring Alex Nicol, Anne Paige & Mary Laura Wood. In a sleepy village, a composer is shot dead and a woman is found gassed. Who killed them and why? [S]

programme.title: The Green Cockatoo
programme.desc: 1937. Crime Drama. Directed by William Cameron Menzies. Stars John Mills, Rene Ray & Robert Newton. A Soho entertainer teams up with a young woman to find out who killed his brother. [S]

programme.title: Tread Softly Stranger
programme.desc: 1958. Crime Drama. Sizzling Calico (Diana Dors) plans a robbery to cover-up embezzlement and gambling debts of brothers John (George Baker) and Dave (Terence Morgan). [S]

programme.title: A Home of Your Own
programme.desc: 1965. Comedy. Directed by Jay Lewis Stars Ronnie Barker, Peter Butterworth & Bernard Cribbins. A wordless, satirical look at British builders as they attempt to build a young couple's dream home.

programme.title: The Writing on the Wall
programme.desc: Mike Read continues his journey across the country to find the Blue Plaques, and the stories behind them. This episode features John and Hayley Mills, Robin Gibb and Brinsworth House. [S]

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: 1944. Drama. Director: Sidney Gilliat. Stars Stewart Granger, John Mills, Alastair Sim & Joy Shelton. After Jim reports for military duty, he suspects that his bride has been seeing another man. [S]

programme.title: Calling All Cars
programme.desc: 1954. Starring Cardew Robinson, Adrienne Fancey, John Fitzgerald and Pauline Olsen. Comedy documentary, centring on the Dover Harbour car terminal. Directed by Maclean Rogers. [S]

programme.title: Look At Life The Ganges Might Lead Anywhere
programme.desc: 1968. An intriguing look at the many different kinds of religion found in India.

programme.title: The Thirty Nine Steps
programme.desc: 1978. Crime. Director: Don Sharp. Stars Robert Powell, Karen Dotrice, David Warner & John Mills. An engineer attempts to prevent Prussian agents from executing a political assassination. [S]

programme.title: Strange But True

programme.title: Doomwatch
programme.desc: The Web of Fear. 1971. Stars Simon Oates, Vivien Sherrard, Stephanie Bidmead. The Scilly Isles are quarantined following a mysterious outbreak of yellow fever. Doomwatch take on the investigation. [S]

programme.title: Cellar Club with Caroline Munro
